meanings.definition: The measure of opposition to the flow of alternating current in a circuit.
meanings.sent1: The impedance of the circuit determines how much it resists the flow of electricity.
meanings.sent2: When analyzing a circuit, it is important to consider the impedance to ensure efficient power transfer.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn impedance of the circuit made it difficult for the electricity to pass through smoothly.
meanings.sent4: The impedance acted like a gatekeeper, regulating the flow of current in the circuit.
meanings.sent5: The impedance was like a traffic jam, slowing down the movement of electricity.
